name: NPR
text:
Nevada has one of the highest rates of new infections, rivaling some of the hardest hit southern states.  

An NPR analysis shows the city could run into trouble with hospital capacity if cases keep climbing.
https://t.co/oA4lBDPafZ

name: NPR
text:
Presumptive Democratic nominee Joe Biden has chosen Sen. Kamala Harris to be his running mate. 

@asmamk has more details about the historic selection. https://t.co/WngexeqJd0 https://t.co/lMNNtKuEOF

name: NPR
text:
TSA officers are finding guns in carry on bags at airport security checkpoints at a rate 3 times higher than they did last summer ‚Äî and 80% of those guns are loaded.
https://t.co/pAYnDUsqyG

name: NPR
text:
Already hampered by the coronavirus, Census Bureau workers are scrambling to visit households that haven't filled out a 2020 census form ‚Äî trying to finish a count that's been cut short by a month.
https://t.co/9QPMBoiC2r

name: NPR
text: Rep. Ilhan Omar has won her primary after facing several challengers ‚Äî the most prominent being a first-time political candidate who said Omar is "out of touch with the district." https://t.co/aPWZFaL3NL

name: NPR
text:
A now-former administrator of Opera Theatre of St. Louis was arrested last month for child sex trafficking in the second degree. The opera company announced Tuesday that Damon Bristo has resigned. 
https://t.co/s7OcbyQczp

name: NPR
text: Chinese and Hong Kong officials vowed the new national security law only would target a small minority. Instead, authorities are rounding up Hong Kongers at all levels of the civil society and education sectors, censoring textbooks and raiding newsrooms. https://t.co/G6j5zVpq2k

name: NPR
text:
Massachusetts now assigns contract tracers to help with errands so people who have COVID-19 can stay in quarantine. It's work more states need to fund, experts say.
https://t.co/XUwVWKn5co

name: NPR
text: For many years, Dr. Jos√© Gabriel L√≥pez-Plascencia was one of the few Spanish-speaking doctors South Phoenix -- someone poor Latinos in the area knew they could go to for health care. Lopez, who died in June, is one of 163,000 killed by COVID-19 in the U.S. https://t.co/osgWxY53Hu

name: NPR
text: It's been five months since the economy ground to a halt, thanks to stay-at-home orders imposed to stop the pandemic. We want to know how you, your family and your workplace are coping. Tell us with this form; an NPR reporter may contact you for a story. https://t.co/nSZcdBzOOs

name: NPR
text: Cherokee County is in the national spotlight, with coronavirus was reported in 19 schools after just one week of classes. Students are now quarantining, but some parents still gathered to cheer the district's choice to repoen without masks. @gpbnews https://t.co/GJUqETki3l

name: NPR
text:
While the coronavirus has prompted other nations to stockpile toilet paper, the Bundesbank says Germans have been stashing more cash than normal.

Cash still makes up 75% of Germany's transactions.
https://t.co/BKfhKEbDlP

name: NPR
text:
New research shows ‚ÄúLatinx‚Äù hasn't really caught on among Latino adults in the U.S. 

While 1 in 4 have heard of the term ‚Äî only 3% use it. https://t.co/unMIRqeSOc

name: NPR
text: Millions of homebound Americans have tried to stock investing in recent months. One app, Robinhood, saw its user base soar from 10 million to 13 million during the first four months of 2020. But some critics say it makes investing feel like a video game. https://t.co/GyTSq77zQh

name: NPR
text:
The Negro Leagues gave rise to many hall of fame worthy players who were never allowed to play in Major League Baseball.

100 years after the league's founding, here's how Black players shaped modern baseball.
https://t.co/YsYf4vI2dD

name: NPR
text:
The coronavirus pandemic couldn't have struck at a worse time for Venezuela. The economy was already struggling, for a variety of reasons. 

Now, it‚Äôs on life support. https://t.co/MGkQLQsflq

name: NPR
text:
For Indiana schools, contact tracing is key to keeping coronavirus cases down ‚Äî but it has been one of the biggest challenges, officials say.

‚ÄúYou're making calls to families that don't know if it's legit and don't really want to sometimes participate."
https://t.co/6VoAoOBtEC

name: NPR
text:
By picking California Sen. Kamala Harris for his running mate, Democratic nominee Joe Biden shows that he doesn't share Trump's obsession with loyalty -- and is ready to go after the president on race issues and immigration. 

More takeaways: https://t.co/4huAjsg9FY

text: By picking California Sen. Kamala Harris for his running mate, Democratic nominee Joe Biden shows that he doesn't share TTrump's obsession with loyalty, and is ready to go after the president on race issues and immigration. https://t.co/sQjsIgqOqM

name: NPR
text: Media titan Sumner Redstone, who built the company Viacom into a global empire, died Tuesday. He was 97. He was known for shrewd investing and deal-making, as well as some ferocious, very public family feuds. https://t.co/Owc9qhx594

name: NPR
text:
Good news! If you're still getting a paycheck, it may get a bit bigger soon.

Bad news: They're going to want all of that back next year.

https://t.co/siLagZ1B90

name: NPR
text:
In the past few years, dirt has turned trendy. Books have appeared. And there‚Äôs a TED Talk about soil health. 

Much of it has to do with the work of a scientist named Rattan Lal. https://t.co/MyJA3yMB5j

name: NPR
text:
About 550 cases from the weeks of protest in Portland, Ore., have been sent for prosecution. 

The district attorney said Tuesday that cases "relating solely to protest activities," including interfering with police or criminal trespass, will be dropped. https://t.co/tQipWgBcFn

name: NPR
text:
Marjorie Taylor Greene has expressed anti-Muslim sentiments, endorsed the baseless QAnon conspiracy theory, and said, "the most mistreated group of people in the United States today are white males."

Now, the Georgia Republican has won her primary runoff. https://t.co/N3SPyP9GRd

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: An investigation into possible insider trading has put on hold a Trump administration deal to give $765 million of taxpayer money to Eastman Kodak to manufacture ingredients used in pharmaceuticals. https://t.co/dc8gXCHmHC

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRCodeSwitch: üó≥Ô∏èNEW EP ALERTüó≥Ô∏è

name: NPR
text:
Fani Willis is poised to become the first woman to lead the district attorney's office in Fulton County, Ga., after winning a runoff election against her former boss, who'd been seeking his seventh term.
 https://t.co/zTIdsIwv0k

name: NPR
text: A Florida sheriff has issued a directive prohibiting deputies, staff and visitors to department offices from wearing protective face masks. https://t.co/YqHeClbY8S

name: NPR
text: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris are giving their first joint remarks as running mates. https://t.co/eJfUDGIsmC

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden and Kamala Harris are making their first joint appearance since Biden announced Harris as his running mate yesterday.

Watch the pair deliver remarks in Biden's hometown of Wilmington, Del. üëá

name: NPR
text:
A federal judge struck down a Trump administration decision to scale back protections for migratory birds ‚Äî and quoted "To Kill A Mockingbird" in her decision: "It is not only a sin to kill a mockingbird, it is also a crime."
https://t.co/gzPi5DpnRh
